TopicTitle: Save Handling between versions when the Tech Tree updates

Articles.Content: Dakota mentioned in the discord tracker that the tech tree may change between versions. how are save files created in an older version of the game going to be handled by new versions of the game when it comes to tech tree changes. Will it handle what parts you have access to by node or by parts previously unlocked or just by crashing the game? Will crafts you could make in an older version of the tree still be launchable or will they grey out like how ksp1 does with temporary unlocked contract parts.
Special attention is paid to keeping saves working between milestones so it won’t be an issue.

I think it was a bad idea to make that promise. It’s likely that they will want to make save-breaking changes and if they can’t, the game will be worse. Sometimes they might have to write code just to migrate things or maintain compatibility, and that’s effort that doesn’t go to improving the game.

I'm sure we remember a lot has been "mentioned" by the devs. However little survives contact with the realities of gamedev. I'd just think it neat if when 1.0 rolls around I could start a save file in 0.2 and then upgrade versions with each milestone kinda like I've seen happen with some minecraft LPs where, if you do it in steps, save files from way back in infdev can be upgraded forwards to the current version of the game.

There wasn't a promise, quite the opposite. Their goal is to make sure the saves are compatible all the way to 1.0 and beyond but since the game is in active development, they can't promise anything and things may break even despite their efforts.
